body_html: The API would not change w.r.t. to the user at all, she would still just make model.load_state_dict(checkpoint['state_dict']) kind of a call as before. It's only when overloading load_state_dict() of a specific module (which is not done currently because it IMHO doesn't help to solve any problem) where the change would be seen. The motivation is to solve cases where the module definition has changed and the mapping between current and saved states doesn't match anymore. For instance, the problem addressed in #2815 could be solved here easily and safely. But anyway, thanks for your time considering the PR.

body: The API would not change w.r.t. to the user at all, she would still just make `model.load_state_dict(checkpoint['state_dict'])` kind of a call as before. It's only when overloading `load_state_dict()` of a specific module (which is not done currently because it IMHO doesn't help to solve any problem) where the change would be seen. The motivation is to solve cases where the module definition has changed and the mapping between current and saved states doesn't match anymore. For instance, the problem addressed in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/2815 could be solved here easily and safely. But anyway, thanks for your time considering the PR.
